00051 extern "C"
00052 void warn_upon_switch(int sig __attribute__((unused)))
00053 {
00054     void *bt[32];
00055     int nentries;
00056 
00057     /* Dump a backtrace to standard error of the frame which caused the switch to
00058        secondary mode: */
00059     nentries = backtrace(bt,sizeof(bt) / sizeof(bt[0]));
00060     backtrace_symbols_fd(bt,nentries,fileno(stderr));
00061 }

00068         INTERNAL_QUAL int rtos_task_create_main(RTOS_TASK* main)
00069         {
00070             // first check if root (or if have sufficient privileges)
00071             if ( geteuid() != 0 ) {
00072 #if ((CONFIG_XENO_VERSION_MAJOR*1000)+(CONFIG_XENO_VERSION_MINOR*100)+CONFIG_XENO_REVISION_LEVEL) >= 2302
00073                 printf( "WARNING: You are not root. This program *may* require that you are root.\n");
00074                 // \todo verify have sufficient privileges
00075 #else
00076                 printf( "You are not root. This program requires that you are root.\n");
00077                 exit(1);
00078 #endif
00079             }
00080 
00081             // locking of all memory for this process
00082             int rv = mlockall(MCL_CURRENT | MCL_FUTURE);
00083             if ( rv != 0 ) {
00084                 perror( "rtos_task_create_main: Could not lock memory using mlockall" ); // Logger unavailable.
00085             }
00086 
00087             struct sched_param param;
00088             // we set the MT to the highest sched priority to allow the console
00089             // to interrupt a loose running thread.
00090             param.sched_priority = sched_get_priority_max(ORO_SCHED_OTHER);
00091             if (param.sched_priority != -1 )
00092                 sched_setscheduler( 0, ORO_SCHED_OTHER, &param);
00093 
00094             const char* mt_name = "MainThread";
00095             main->sched_type = SCHED_XENOMAI_SOFT; // default for MainThread
00096             main->name = strncpy( (char*)malloc( (strlen(mt_name)+1)*sizeof(char) ), mt_name, strlen(mt_name)+1 );
00097 
00098             int ret = -1;
00099             while( ret != 0) {
00100                 // name, priority, mode
00101                 if ( (ret = rt_task_shadow( &(main->xenotask),mt_name, 0, 0)) != 0 ) {
00102                     if ( ret == -ENOMEM ) {
00103                         // fail: abort
00104                         printf( "Cannot rt_task_create() MainThread: Out of memory.\n");
00105                         exit(1);
00106                     }
00107                     if ( ret == -EBUSY ) {
00108                         // ok: we are a xeno thread (may log() ):
00109                         log(Info) << "MainThread already a Xenomai task." <<endlog();
00110                         break;
00111                     }
00112                     if ( ret == -EEXIST ) {
00113                         // fail: retry without using a name.
00114                         mt_name = 0; // do not register
00115                         continue;
00116                     }
00117                     if ( ret == -EPERM ) {
00118                         // fail: abort
00119                         printf( "Can not rt_task_create() MainThread: No permission.\n");
00120                         exit(1);
00121                     }
00122                     // uncaught error: abort
00123                     printf( "Can not rt_task_create() MainThread: Error %d.\n",ret);
00124                     exit(1);
00125                 }
00126             }
00127             // We are a xeno thread now:
00128             // Only use Logger after this point (i.e. when rt_task_shadow was succesful).
00129             if ( mt_name == 0) {
00130                 log(Warning) << "'MainThread' name was already in use. Registered empty name with Xenomai.\n" <<endlog();
00131             }
00132 
00133             // main is created in main thread.
00134             main->xenoptr = rt_task_self();
00135 
00136 #ifdef OROSEM_OS_XENO_PERIODIC
00137 # if CONFIG_XENO_VERSION_MAJOR == 2 && CONFIG_XENO_VERSION_MINOR == 0
00138             // time in nanoseconds
00139             rt_timer_start( ORODAT_OS_XENO_PERIODIC_TICK*1000*1000*1000 );
00140             Logger::In in("Scheduler");
00141             Logger::log() << Logger::Info << "Xenomai Periodic Timer started using "<<ORODAT_OS_XENO_PERIODIC_TICK<<" seconds." << Logger::endl;
00142 # else
00143             Logger::In in("Scheduler");
00144             Logger::log() << Logger::Error << "Set Xenomai Periodic Timer using the Linux kernel configuration." << Logger::endl;
00145 # endif
00146 #else
00147 # if CONFIG_XENO_VERSION_MAJOR == 2 && CONFIG_XENO_VERSION_MINOR == 0
00148             rt_timer_start( TM_ONESHOT );
00149             Logger::log() << Logger::Info << "Xenomai Periodic Timer runs in preemptive 'one-shot' mode." << Logger::endl;
00150 # else
00151 #  if CONFIG_XENO_OPT_TIMING_PERIODIC
00152             Logger::log() << Logger::Info << "Xenomai Periodic Timer configured in 'periodic' mode." << Logger::endl;
00153 #   else
00154             Logger::log() << Logger::Info << "Xenomai Periodic Timer runs in preemptive 'one-shot' mode." << Logger::endl;
00155 #  endif
00156 # endif
00157 #endif
00158             log(Info) << "Installing SIGXCPU handler." <<endlog();
00159             //signal(SIGXCPU, warn_upon_switch);
00160             struct sigaction sa;
00161             sa.sa_handler = warn_upon_switch;
00162             sigemptyset( &sa.sa_mask );
00163             sa.sa_flags = 0;
00164             sigaction(SIGXCPU, &sa, 0);
00165 
00166             Logger::log() << Logger::Debug << "Xenomai Timer and Main Task Created" << Logger::endl;
00167             return 0;
00168         }
00169 
00170         INTERNAL_QUAL int rtos_task_delete_main(RTOS_TASK* main_task)
00171         {
00172             //rt_task_delete( &(main_task->xenotask) );
00173             free (main_task->name);
00174             munlockall();
00175             return 0;
00176         }

00179         struct XenoCookie {
00180             void* data;
00181             void* (*wrapper)(void*);
00182         };
00183 
00184         INTERNAL_QUAL void rtos_xeno_thread_wrapper( void* cookie )
00185         {
00186             // store 'self'
00187             RTOS_TASK* task = ((ThreadInterface*)((XenoCookie*)cookie)->data)->getTask();
00188             task->xenoptr = rt_task_self();
00189             assert( task->xenoptr );
00190 
00191             // call user function
00192             ((XenoCookie*)cookie)->wrapper( ((XenoCookie*)cookie)->data );
00193             free(cookie);
00194         }
00195 
00196         INTERNAL_QUAL int rtos_task_create(RTOS_TASK* task,
00197                                            int priority,
00198                                            unsigned cpu_affinity,
00199                                            const char* name,
00200                                            int sched_type,
00201                                            size_t stack_size,
00202                                            void * (*start_routine)(void *),
00203                                            ThreadInterface* obj)
00204         {
00205             rtos_task_check_priority(&sched_type, &priority);
00206             XenoCookie* xcookie = (XenoCookie*)malloc( sizeof(XenoCookie) );
00207             xcookie->data = obj;
00208             xcookie->wrapper = start_routine;
00209             if ( name == 0 || strlen(name) == 0)
00210                 name = "XenoThread";
00211             task->name = strncpy( (char*)malloc( (strlen(name)+1)*sizeof(char) ), name, strlen(name)+1 );
00212             task->sched_type = sched_type; // User requested scheduler.
00213             int rv;
00214 
00215             unsigned int aff = 0;
00216             if ( cpu_affinity != 0 ) {
00217                 // calculate affinity:
00218                 for(unsigned i = 0; i < 8*sizeof(cpu_affinity); i++) {
00219                     if(cpu_affinity & (1 << i)) { 
00220                         // RTHAL_NR_CPUS is defined in the kernel, not in user space. So we just limit up to 7, until Xenomai allows us to get the maximum.
00221                 if ( i > 7 ) {
00222               const unsigned int all_cpus = ~0;
00223               if ( cpu_affinity != all_cpus ) // suppress this warning when ~0 is provided
00224                             log(Warning) << "rtos_task_create: ignoring cpu_affinity for "<< name << " on CPU " << i << " since it's larger than RTHAL_NR_CPUS - 1 (="<< 7 <<")"<<endlog();
00225                         } else {
00226                             aff |= T_CPU(i); 
00227             }
00228                     }
00229                 }
00230             }
00231 
00232         if (stack_size == 0) {
00233           log(Debug) << "Raizing default stack size to 128kb for Xenomai threads in Orocos." <<endlog();
00234           stack_size = 128000;
00235         }
00236 
00237             // task, name, stack, priority, mode, fun, arg
00238             // UGLY, how can I check in Xenomai that a name is in use before calling rt_task_spawn ???
00239             rv = rt_task_spawn(&(task->xenotask), name, stack_size, priority, T_JOINABLE | aff, rtos_xeno_thread_wrapper, xcookie);
00240             if ( rv == -EEXIST ) {
00241                 free( task->name );
00242                 task->name = strncpy( (char*)malloc( (strlen(name)+2)*sizeof(char) ), name, strlen(name)+1 );
00243                 task->name[ strlen(name) ] = '0';
00244                 task->name[ strlen(name)+1 ] = 0;
00245                 while ( rv == -EEXIST &&  task->name[ strlen(name) ] != '9') {
00246                     task->name[ strlen(name) ] += 1;
00247                     rv = rt_task_spawn(&(task->xenotask), task->name, stack_size, priority, T_JOINABLE | aff, rtos_xeno_thread_wrapper, xcookie);
00248                 }
00249             }
00250             if ( rv == -EEXIST ) {
00251                 log(Warning) << name << ": an object with that name is already existing in Xenomai." << endlog();
00252                 rv = rt_task_spawn(&(task->xenotask), 0, stack_size, priority, T_JOINABLE | aff, rtos_xeno_thread_wrapper, xcookie);
00253             }
00254             if ( rv != 0) {
00255                 log(Error) << name << " : CANNOT INIT Xeno TASK " << task->name <<" error code: "<< rv << endlog();
00256                 return rv;
00257             }
00258 
00259             rt_task_yield();
00260             return 0;
00261         }
00262 
00263         INTERNAL_QUAL void rtos_task_yield(RTOS_TASK*) {
00264             rt_task_yield();
00265         }
00266 
00267         INTERNAL_QUAL int rtos_task_is_self(const RTOS_TASK* task) {
00268             RT_TASK* self = rt_task_self();
00269             if (self == 0 || task == 0)
00270                 return -1; // non-xeno thread. We could try to compare pthreads like in gnulinux ?
00271 #if ((CONFIG_XENO_VERSION_MAJOR*1000)+(CONFIG_XENO_VERSION_MINOR*100)+CONFIG_XENO_REVISION_LEVEL) >= 2500
00272             if ( rt_task_same( self, task->xenoptr ) != 0 )
00273                 return 1;
00274 #else
00275             // older versions:
00276             if ( self == task->xenoptr ) // xenoptr is also set by rt_task_self() during construction.
00277                 return 1;
00278 #endif
00279             return 0;
00280         }

00283     INTERNAL_QUAL int rtos_task_check_scheduler(int* scheduler)
00284     {
00285         if (*scheduler != SCHED_XENOMAI_HARD && *scheduler != SCHED_XENOMAI_SOFT ) {
00286             log(Error) << "Unknown scheduler type." <<endlog();
00287             *scheduler = SCHED_XENOMAI_SOFT;
00288             return -1;
00289         }
00290         return 0;
00291     }
00292 
00293     INTERNAL_QUAL int rtos_task_check_priority(int* scheduler, int* priority)
00294     {
00295         int ret = 0;
00296         // check scheduler first.
00297         ret = rtos_task_check_scheduler(scheduler);
00298 
00299         // correct priority
00300         // Hard & Soft:
00301 #if ((CONFIG_XENO_VERSION_MAJOR*10000)+(CONFIG_XENO_VERSION_MINOR*100)+CONFIG_XENO_REVISION_LEVEL) >= 20500
00302         const int minprio = 0;
00303 #else
00304         const int minprio = 1;
00305 #endif
00306         if (*priority < minprio){
00307             log(Warning) << "Forcing priority ("<<*priority<<") of thread to " << minprio <<"." <<endlog();
00308             *priority = minprio;
00309             ret = -1;
00310         }
00311         if (*priority > 99){
00312             log(Warning) << "Forcing priority ("<<*priority<<") of thread to 99." <<endlog();
00313             *priority = 99;
00314             ret = -1;
00315         }
00316         return ret;
00317     }

00320         // we could implement here the interrupt shield logic.
00321         INTERNAL_QUAL int rtos_task_set_scheduler(RTOS_TASK* t, int sched_type) {
00322             // xenoptr was initialised from the thread wrapper.
00323             if (t->xenoptr != rt_task_self() ) {
00324                 return -1;
00325             }
00326 
00327             if ( rtos_task_check_scheduler( &sched_type ) == -1)
00328                 return -1;
00329 
00330             if (sched_type == SCHED_XENOMAI_HARD) {
00331                 if ( rt_task_set_mode( 0, T_PRIMARY, 0 ) == 0 ) {
00332                     t->sched_type = SCHED_XENOMAI_HARD;
00333                     return 0;
00334                 } else {
00335                     return -1;
00336                 }
00337             } else {
00338                 if ( sched_type == SCHED_XENOMAI_SOFT) {
00339                     // This mode setting is only temporary. See rtos_task_wait_period() as well !
00340                     if (rt_task_set_mode( T_PRIMARY, 0, 0 ) == 0 ) {
00341                         t->sched_type = SCHED_XENOMAI_SOFT;
00342                         return 0;
00343                     } else {
00344                         return -1;
00345                     }
00346                 }
00347             }
00348             assert(false);
00349             return -1;
00350         }

00352         INTERNAL_QUAL int rtos_task_get_scheduler(const RTOS_TASK* mytask) {
00353 #if 0
00354             // WORK AROUND constness: (need non-const mytask)
00355             RT_TASK* tt = mytask->xenoptr;
00356             RT_TASK_INFO info;
00357             if ( tt )
00358                 if ( rt_task_inquire( tt, &info) == 0 )
00359                     if ( info.status & XNRELAX )
00360                         return SCHED_XENOMAI_SOFT;
00361                     else
00362                         return SCHED_XENOMAI_HARD;
00363             return -1;
00364 #else
00365             return mytask->sched_type;
00366 #endif
00367         }

00369         INTERNAL_QUAL void rtos_task_make_periodic(RTOS_TASK* mytask, NANO_TIME nanosecs )
00370         {
00371             if (nanosecs == 0) {
00372                 rt_task_set_periodic( &(mytask->xenotask), TM_NOW, TM_INFINITE);
00373             }
00374             else {
00375                 rt_task_set_periodic( &(mytask->xenotask), TM_NOW, rt_timer_ns2ticks(nanosecs) );
00376             }
00377         }
00378 
00379         INTERNAL_QUAL void rtos_task_set_period( RTOS_TASK* mytask, NANO_TIME nanosecs )
00380         {
00381             rtos_task_make_periodic( mytask, nanosecs);
00382             //rt_task_set_period(&(mytask->xenotask), rt_timer_ns2ticks( nanosecs ));
00383         }

00385         INTERNAL_QUAL void rtos_task_set_wait_period_policy( RTOS_TASK* task, int policy )
00386         {
00387           // Do nothing
00388         }

00390         INTERNAL_QUAL int rtos_task_wait_period( RTOS_TASK* mytask )
00391         {
00392             // detect overrun.
00393 #if CONFIG_XENO_VERSION_MAJOR == 2 && CONFIG_XENO_VERSION_MINOR == 0
00394             if ( rt_task_wait_period() == -ETIMEDOUT)
00395                 return 1;
00396 #else // 2.1, 2.2, 2.3, 2.4,...
00397             long unsigned int overrun = 0;
00398             rt_task_wait_period(&overrun);
00399 
00400             // When running soft, switch to secondary mode:
00401             if ( mytask->sched_type == SCHED_XENOMAI_SOFT )
00402                 rt_task_set_mode(T_PRIMARY, 0, 0 );
00403 
00404             if ( overrun != 0)
00405                 return 1;
00406 #endif
00407             return 0;
00408         }

00411     {
00412         log(Error) << "rtos_task_set_cpu_affinity: Xenomai tasks don't allow to migrate to another CPU once created." << endlog();
00413         return -1;
00414     }

00421         INTERNAL_QUAL const char* rtos_task_get_name(const RTOS_TASK* mytask) {
00422             return mytask->name;
00423         }

00425         INTERNAL_QUAL int rtos_task_get_priority(const RTOS_TASK* mytask) {
00426             RT_TASK_INFO info;
00427             // WORK AROUND constness: (need non-const mytask)
00428             RT_TASK* tt = mytask->xenoptr;
00429             if ( tt )
00430                 if ( rt_task_inquire ( tt, &info) == 0 )
00431                     return info.bprio;
00432             return -1;
00433         }
00434 
00435         INTERNAL_QUAL void rtos_task_delete(RTOS_TASK* mytask) {
00436             if ( rt_task_join(&(mytask->xenotask)) != 0 ) {
00437                 log(Error) << "Failed to join with thread " << mytask->name << endlog();
00438             }
00439             rt_task_delete(&(mytask->xenotask));
00440         }

00442         INTERNAL_QUAL int rtos_task_set_priority(RTOS_TASK * mytask, int priority)
00443         {
00444             // ignorint 'type'
00445             RT_TASK* tt = mytask->xenoptr;
00446             if ( tt )
00447                 return rt_task_set_priority( tt, priority);
00448             return -1;
00449         }
00450     }
